title: Warren, Porter Criticize Wall Street Arbitration After Judge Says Process Was Manipulated
sub_head: Letter to Finra follows Georgia judge’s decision that Wells Fargo manipulated arbitrator selection process
body:
Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D., Mass.) and Rep. Katie Porter (D., Calif.) called out Wall Street’s self-regulator, questioning how it handles disputes between brokers and their customers.
The two lawmakers wrote to the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority’s top executive after a Georgia judge ruled in a recent case that a lawyer for Wells Fargo & Co. gamed the system for choosing arbitrators.
